about_the_game:
{REVAMP AVAILABLE} Kalymn Nox is the Albino Hunter (the hunter with albinism); even his pretentious and slightly racist title can't keep him from waking up broke after a night of drinking. Join him as he takes on various jobs throughout the land which include:

-Spontaneous Engagement
-A Telepathic Lizard
-A Witch with a Poorly Insulated Castle

And hey! That was just in the Demo alone! The Full Version will include various additional plot lines, an updated Battle System, more Party Members, and even an Interdimensional Mini-Game.

Recommended Age: 14+

{EDIT}
There is a revamped version of this game available which includes a lot more features, achievements, and overall more polished content. There are various reasons why the revamp exists as its own separate form, which are too lengthy to go over here. However, I have left this old version up in the event that someone (A) out there might want to compare and contrast the two versions, (B) cannot afford the newer version, or (C) simply wants to play this version for the sake of nostalgia. I also don't want to risk taking this game down in the event that the legacy users would lose their money and/or the product. So please take this into consideration before deciding to purchase either game. :)

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows XP/Vista/7/8
  • Processor: Intel Pentium 4 1.5GHz or better
  • Memory: 128 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Onboard graphics card will be plenty
  • Storage: 750 MB available space

reviews:
“Hands down one of the craziest games I've played. The character banter was awesome, the story is just out there sometimes, and I can see myself replaying this game more than once...because it's quite possible to miss a lot of things this game has to offer on the first playthrough.”
7.4/10 – EndlessXGaming

“I’ll give this game 4 out of 5 stars. This game was really, really funny, and really, really entertaining. The characters were lovable, and all and all, I just had a great time playing it. It was not in The Tokyo Dome nor was Misawa in it, so I can only give this game four stars, though.”
4/5 Stars – ScheLPs

“Running time around ten hours, the game really doesn’t overstay its welcome, so it’s a really good pick up and play game. As well, if you just wanna play it from start to finish in one go, you’re very welcome to do so. You don’t need that much grinding...So, yeah, pick up and give it a try. Albino Hunter—it’s right now on Steam so you can get it. …The selling point that got me into the game: it’s not expensive. … And honestly, for the price it had, it’s very well worth it…[T]his is a game I would have loved to be able to play twenty years ago, when I was a little kid, and I would have loved to play something like this on the Super Nintendo. You know, it’s games like these that I say, twenty years ago [if] this would have come out for the Super Nintendo, it would have been so famous. It would have been comparable to a Final Fantasy because…back in the day, not many games were too long…[A] ten hour RPG is just, honestly, the sweet point for me.”
10/10 – ARMR Studios
